greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A193231(A268387(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: The following two formulas are equivalent because A193231 distributes over bitwise XOR (A003987):
Alternative definition, for n, k >= 1, where XOR denotes A003987:
mathematica: f[n_] := Which[0 <= # <= 1, #, EvenQ@ #, BitXor[2 #, #] &[f[#/2]], True, BitXor[#, 2 # + 1] &[f[(# - 1)/2]]] &@ Abs@ n; {0}~Join~Table[f[BitXor @@ Map[Last, FactorInteger@ n]], {n, 2, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 12 2016, after _Robert G. Wilson v_ at A048724 and A065621 *)
program: a268387(n) = {my(f = factor(n), b = 0); for (k=1, #f~, b = bitxor(b, f[k, 2]); ); b; }
xref: A003987, A048720, A059897, A193231, A268385, A268387 are used in definitions of this sequence.
Cf. A000028 (indices of odd numbers), A000379 (indices of even numbers), A268390 (indices of zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 10 2016
